#summary N3 examples of real bugs

[http://www.w3.org/2000/10/swap/doc/Overview.html N3] makes it much easier to write out RDF graphs. Here are a few examples of real bugs written out using the N3 notation

== Simple html bug tracking system: Issue rdfms-abouteachprefix ==

[http://www.w3.org/2000/03/rdf-tracking/#rdfms-abouteachprefix Issue rdfms-about eachprefix] is writen out in simple html, in the you-can-get-no-simpler-than-this-bug-tracking-system (patent pending) of the w3c.

{{{
@prefix : <http://xmlns.com/baetle/0.1/ns#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix awol: <http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#> .
@prefix wf:   <http://www.w3.org/2005/01/wf/flow#> .


<http://www.w3.org/2000/03/rdf-tracking/#rdfms-abouteachprefix>
    a :Issue ; 
    :title "Issue rdfms-abouteachprefix: Something should be done about aboutEachPrefix construct"; 
    :reporter <http://www.w3.org/People/Berners-Lee/card#i>;
    :raised "2000-02-29T00:00:00T"^^xsd:dateTime;
    :summary "Split of the editor module into multiple modules"@en;
    wf:state [ a :Solution;
               :comment [ a awol:Content;
                          awol:body """<div>On 1st June 2001, the WG decided that aboutEachPrefix would be removed from the RDF Model and Syntax Recommendation on the grounds that there is a lack of implementation experience, and it therefore should not be in the recommendation. A future version of RDF may consider support for this feature.</div>""";
                         awol:type "text/html";
                      ];
           ];
    :comment [ a awol:Content;
               awol:body """<div><p>See also:</p>
<ul>
  <li>search of RDF list archives for <a href="http://search.w3.org/Public/cgi-bin/query?mss=simple&amp;pg=q&amp;what=web&amp;filter=lists&amp;fmt=.&amp;q=%2Bwww-rdf+%2BaboutEachPrefix">"aboutEachPrefix"</a></li>
  <li><a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-rdf-syntax-19990222/#URIPrefix">Model+Syntax
    REC, 3.4. Containers Defined By A URI Pattern</a></li>
</ul>
</div>""";
            awol:type "text/html";
            ];
    .

}}}

Note: there is a problem here. A Comment can't be an awol:Content. There has to be something in between, that gives the author of the comment and the date at which it was made at least (though this would not be used here). Is this where we would need an awol:Entry? The annoying thing about an awol:Entry is that it forces us to take too much: a title and an id.... 

== Netbeans Bug 59890 ==

[http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890 Bug 59890] is a real bug and can be browsed on the web. Most URLs below are correctly dereferenceable. (there are some imaginary URLS for things that should be specific to NetBeans bug database)

{{{
@prefix : <http://xmlns.com/baetle/0.1/ns#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .

<http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?rev=1.28>
       a foaf:Document, :Version;
       :previous <http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?rev=1.27> .

<http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?r1=1.27&r2=1.28>
      a :Diff;
      :from <http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?rev=1.27>;
      :to <http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?rev=1.28> .

//There is no url currently for the commit events (I think one would have to search through the email archives to extract the groups of these events
//this is a really simple commit event (only one file in there)
_:commit1 
   a :Committing;
   :author [ a foaf:Person;
             foaf:nick "jtulach" ];
   :contains <http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/beans/src/org/netbeans/modules/beans/BeanPatternGenerator.java?rev=1.28>;
   :message "#59890: The arguments for event's constructor aren't provided into the fire method";
   :relates-to <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#it> .


//from the above message we can relate the bug to the ?commit events or versions?
//I suppose it is easier to relate it to source code versions for the moment. It is easy to find which commit events it is part of later
//Here it occured to me that the fix should be the place which links all the source code changes. But probably this is not a real big deal, since O suppose there would only be one fix per bug report.

<http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#it>
    a :Defect ;
    :status :Fix;
    :state [ a :Fix;
             :resolvedWith _:commit1;
           ];
    :assignedTo [ foaf:mbox <mailto:issues@openide.sun.com> ];
    :contact  [ foaf:mbox <mailto:issues@openide.sun.com> ];
    :reporter [ :nick "bryonabbott"];
    :summary [ :body "The arguments for event's constructor aren't provided into the fire method" ];
    :hasDuplicate <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=48123#it>;
    :comment <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#desc2>,
             <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#desc3>,
             <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#desc4>,
             <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#desc5>,
             <http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=59890#desc6>;
    :platform <http://wiki.netbeans.org/baetle/PC#it>;
    :operatingSystem <http://wiki.netbeans.org/baetle/Linux#it>;
    :targetMilestone <http://wiki.netbeans.org/baetle/Future>;
    :priority <http://wiki.netbeans.org/baetle/priority#P3> .
}}}
